description: Installation of 1x Fascia sign; 1 x High level fascia sign;1 x Projecting sign; 1 x Rear fascia sign; 4 x Totem signage on Retail Park sign (Advertisement Consent)
decision_conditions: SCHEDULE 2: CONDITIONS IMPOSED BY THE AUTHORITY

7. The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: A050 Rev B (Location Plans); SUP D 001 (Proposed Signage); A211 (Proposed Rear Elevation and Totem Pole Signage); A210 Rev D (Proposed Shopfront Elevation and Part Section); A002 (Existing Shopfront Elevation).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

8. Notwithstanding the approved plans, the illumination of the signs/advertisements shall comply with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Professionals in in their guidance document published 2015, PLG05 Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements.

Reason: To safeguard amenity and in the interests of public safety to accord with Paragraph 136 of the NPPF (2021), Policies D3, D4, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
9. The illumination of the signs/advertisements shall be constant and not appear to be intermittent or flashing.

Reason: To safeguard amenity and in the interests of public safety to accord with Paragraph 136 of the NPPF (2021), Policies D3, D4, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| SCHEDULE 1: CONDITIONS IMPOSED BY THE REGULATIONS
1. The consent shall expire after a period of five (5) years from the date of this notice.
2. Any advertisements displayed and any site used for the displays of advertisement shall be maintained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
3. Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition.
4.  Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
5. No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

6. No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure or hinder the ready interpretation of any of traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, waterway (including any coastal waters) or aerodrome (civil or military).
